content: **about the pattern ** this shawl was inspired by estonian lace and especially the beautiful shawl laminaria by elizabeth freeman this shawl also shares the blossom stitch with that shawl the border is inspired by various designs but mostly i had a mental picture of how i wanted it to look so i tried to transfer that mental image to a chart and yes it came out exactly the way i wanted i m flattered if you want to knit this pattern it s my first knitting design and i would love to see my design on your shoulders if you alter or use only parts of my pattern please don t forget to link back **french translation ** thanks to catherine petit the pattern was available in french **german translation** thanks to jennifer linguanti the pattern was available in german **other ** the turquoise version is knitted in nyansera bijou 2 ply and the yellow in nyansera sundari silk 4 ply and these are the yarns used in the pattern i would also like to thank my testknitters for helping me with correcting pattern faults misspellings etc lismete 1 evaihalmstad 2 and lilja2 3 **kal** i started a kal group 4 when pattern was launched it s not very active but it contains useful posts for people looking for help with the pattern a new kal has been launched by the site historic crafts they can be found here 5 direct download 6 1 http //www ravelry com/projects/lismete/echo-flower-shawl-test-knit 2 http //www ravelry com/projects/evaihalmstad/echo-flower-shawl 3 http //www ravelry com/projects/lilja2/raspberry-echo-flowers 4 http //www ravelry com/groups/echo-flower-shawl-kal 5 http //www ravelry com/discuss/historic-crafts/1418382/1-25 6 http //johnen se/echoflowers pdf
